js/tiny_mce/plugins/paste/editor_plugin_src.js
  1.   1  /**
  2.   2   * editor_plugin_src.js
  3.   3   *
  4.   4   * Copyright 2009, Moxiecode Systems AB
  5.   5   * Released under LGPL License.
  6.   6   *
  7.   7   * License: http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/license
  8.   8   * Contributing: http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/contributing
  9.   9   */
  10.  10  
  11.  11  (function() {
  12.  12   var each = tinymce.each,
  13.  13   defs = {
  14.  14   paste_auto_cleanup_on_paste : true,
  15.  15   paste_enable_default_filters : true,
  16.  16   paste_block_drop : false,
  17.  17   paste_retain_style_properties : "none",
  18.  18   paste_strip_class_attributes : "mso",
  19.  19   paste_remove_spans : false,
  20.  20   paste_remove_styles : false,
  21.  21   paste_remove_styles_if_webkit : true,
  22.  22   paste_convert_middot_lists : true,
  23.  23   paste_convert_headers_to_strong : false,
  24.  24   paste_dialog_width : "450",
  25.  25   paste_dialog_height : "400",
  26.  26   paste_text_use_dialog : false,
  27.  27   paste_text_sticky : false,
  28.  28   paste_text_notifyalways : false,
  29.  29   paste_text_linebreaktype : "p",
  30.  30   paste_text_replacements : [
  31.  31   [/\u2026/g, "..."],
  32.  32   [/[\x93\x94\u201c\u201d]/g, '"'],
  33.  33   [/[\x60\x91\x92\u2018\u2019]/g, "'"]
  34.  34   ]
  35.  35   };
  36.  36  
  37.  37   function getParam(ed, name) {
  38.  38   return ed.getParam(name, defs[name]);
  39.  39   }
  40.  40  
  41.  41   tinymce.create('tinymce.plugins.PastePlugin', {
  42.  42   init : function(ed, url) {
  43.  43   var t = this;
  44.  44  
  45.  45   t.editor = ed;
  46.  46   t.url = url;
  47.  47  
  48.  48   // Setup plugin events
  49.  49   t.onPreProcess = new tinymce.util.Dispatcher(t);
  50.  50   t.onPostProcess = new tinymce.util.Dispatcher(t);
  51.  51  
  52.  52   // Register default handlers
  53.  53   t.onPreProcess.add(t._preProcess);
  54.  54   t.onPostProcess.add(t._postProcess);
  55.  55  
  56.  56   // Register optional preprocess handler
  57.  57   t.onPreProcess.add(function(pl, o) {
  58.  58   ed.execCallback('paste_preprocess', pl, o);
  59.  59   });
  60.  60  
  61.  61   // Register optional postprocess
  62.  62   t.onPostProcess.add(function(pl, o) {
  63.  63   ed.execCallback('paste_postprocess', pl, o);
  64.  64   });
  65.  65  
  66.  66   ed.onKeyDown.addToTop(function(ed, e) {
  67.  67   // Block ctrl+v from adding an undo level since the default logic in tinymce.Editor will add that
  68.  68   if (((tinymce.isMac ? e.metaKey : e.ctrlKey) && e.keyCode == 86) || (e.shiftKey && e.keyCode == 45))
  69.  69   return false; // Stop other listeners
  70.  70   });
  71.  71  
  72.  72   // Initialize plain text flag
  73.  73   ed.pasteAsPlainText = false;
  74.  74  
  75.  75   // This function executes the process handlers and inserts the contents
  76.  76   // force_rich overrides plain text mode set by user, important for pasting with execCommand
  77.  77   function process(o, force_rich) {
  78.  78   var dom = ed.dom, rng, nodes;
  79.  79  
  80.  80   // Execute pre process handlers
  81.  81   t.onPreProcess.dispatch(t, o);
  82.  82  
  83.  83   // Create DOM structure
  84.  84   o.node = dom.create('div', 0, o.content);
  85.  85  
  86.  86   // If pasting inside the same element and the contents is only one block
  87.  87   // remove the block and keep the text since Firefox will copy parts of pre and h1-h6 as a pre element
  88.  88   if (tinymce.isGecko) {
  89.  89   rng = ed.selection.getRng(true);
  90.  90   if (rng.startContainer == rng.endContainer && rng.startContainer.nodeType == 3) {
  91.  91   nodes = dom.select('p,h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6,pre', o.node);
  92.  92  
  93.  93   // Is only one block node and it doesn't contain word stuff
  94.  94   if (nodes.length == 1 && o.content.indexOf('__MCE_ITEM__') === -1)
  95.  95   dom.remove(nodes.reverse(), true);
  96.  96   }
  97.  97   }
  98.  98  
  99.  99   // Execute post process handlers
  100. 100   t.onPostProcess.dispatch(t, o);
  101. 101  
  102. 102   // Serialize content
  103. 103   o.content = ed.serializer.serialize(o.node, {getInner : 1});
  104. 104  
  105. 105   // Plain text option active?
  106. 106   if ((!force_rich) && (ed.pasteAsPlainText)) {
  107. 107   t._insertPlainText(ed, dom, o.content);
  108. 108  
  109. 109   if (!getParam(ed, "paste_text_sticky")) {
  110. 110   ed.pasteAsPlainText = false;
  111. 111   ed.controlManager.setActive("pastetext", false);
  112. 112   }
  113. 113   } else {
  114. 114   t._insert(o.content);
  115. 115   }
  116. 116   }
  117. 117  
  118. 118   // Add command for external usage
  119. 119   ed.addCommand('mceInsertClipboardContent', function(u, o) {
  120. 120   process(o, true);
  121. 121   });
  122. 122  
  123. 123   if (!getParam(ed, "paste_text_use_dialog")) {
  124. 124   ed.addCommand('mcePasteText', function(u, v) {
  125. 125   var cookie = tinymce.util.Cookie;
  126. 126  
  127. 127   ed.pasteAsPlainText = !ed.pasteAsPlainText;
  128. 128   ed.controlManager.setActive('pastetext', ed.pasteAsPlainText);
  129. 129  
  130. 130   if ((ed.pasteAsPlainText) && (!cookie.get("tinymcePasteText"))) {
  131. 131   if (getParam(ed, "paste_text_sticky")) {
  132. 132   ed.windowManager.alert(ed.translate('paste.plaintext_mode_sticky'));
  133. 133   } else {
  134. 134   ed.windowManager.alert(ed.translate('paste.plaintext_mode_sticky'));
  135. 135   }
  136. 136  
  137. 137   if (!getParam(ed, "paste_text_notifyalways")) {
  138. 138   cookie.set("tinymcePasteText", "1", new Date(new Date().getFullYear() + 1, 12, 31))
  139. 139   }
  140. 140   }
  141. 141   });
  142. 142   }
  143. 143  
  144. 144   ed.addButton('pastetext', {title: 'paste.paste_text_desc', cmd: 'mcePasteText'});
  145. 145   ed.addButton('selectall', {title: 'paste.selectall_desc', cmd: 'selectall'});
  146. 146  
  147. 147   // This function grabs the contents from the clipboard by adding a
  148. 148   // hidden div and placing the caret inside it and after the browser paste
  149. 149   // is done it grabs that contents and processes that
  150. 150   function grabContent(e) {
  151. 151   var n, or, rng, oldRng, sel = ed.selection, dom = ed.dom, body = ed.getBody(), posY, textContent;
  152. 152  
  153. 153   // Check if browser supports direct plaintext access
  154. 154   if (e.clipboardData || dom.doc.dataTransfer) {
  155. 155   textContent = (e.clipboardData || dom.doc.dataTransfer).getData('Text');
  156. 156  
  157. 157   if (ed.pasteAsPlainText) {
  158. 158   e.preventDefault();
  159. 159   process({content : textContent.replace(/\r?\n/g, '<br />')});
  160. 160   return;
  161. 161   }
  162. 162   }
  163. 163  
  164. 164   if (dom.get('_mcePaste'))
  165. 165   return;
  166. 166  
  167. 167   // Create container to paste into
  168. 168   n = dom.add(body, 'div', {id : '_mcePaste', 'class' : 'mcePaste', 'data-mce-bogus' : '1'}, '\uFEFF\uFEFF<br data-mce-bogus="1">');
  169. 169  
  170. 170   // If contentEditable mode we need to find out the position of the closest element
  171. 171   if (body != ed.getDoc().body)
  172. 172   posY = dom.getPos(ed.selection.getStart(), body).y;
  173. 173   else
  174. 174   posY = body.scrollTop + dom.getViewPort().y;
  175. 175  
  176. 176   // Styles needs to be applied after the element is added to the document since WebKit will otherwise remove all styles
  177. 177   dom.setStyles(n, {
  178. 178   position : 'absolute',
  179. 179   left : -10000,
  180. 180   top : posY,
  181. 181   width : 1,
  182. 182   height : 1,
  183. 183   overflow : 'hidden'
  184. 184   });
  185. 185  
  186. 186   if (tinymce.isIE) {
  187. 187   // Store away the old range
  188. 188   oldRng = sel.getRng();
  189. 189  
  190. 190   // Select the container
  191. 191   rng = dom.doc.body.createTextRange();
  192. 192   rng.moveToElementText(n);
  193. 193   rng.execCommand('Paste');
  194. 194  
  195. 195   // Remove container
  196. 196   dom.remove(n);
  197. 197  
  198. 198   // Check if the contents was changed, if it wasn't then clipboard extraction failed probably due
  199. 199   // to IE security settings so we pass the junk though better than nothing right
  200. 200   if (n.innerHTML === '\uFEFF') {
  201. 201   ed.execCommand('mcePasteWord');
  202. 202   e.preventDefault();
  203. 203   return;
  204. 204   }
  205. 205  
  206. 206   // Restore the old range and clear the contents before pasting
  207. 207   sel.setRng(oldRng);
  208. 208   sel.setContent('');
  209. 209  
  210. 210   // For some odd reason we need to detach the the mceInsertContent call from the paste event
  211. 211   // It's like IE has a reference to the parent element that you paste in and the selection gets messed up
  212. 212   // when it tries to restore the selection
  213. 213   setTimeout(function() {
  214. 214   // Process contents
  215. 215   process({content : n.innerHTML});
  216. 216   }, 0);
  217. 217  
  218. 218   // Block the real paste event
  219. 219   return tinymce.dom.Event.cancel(e);
  220. 220   } else {
  221. 221   function block(e) {
  222. 222   e.preventDefault();
  223. 223   };
  224. 224  
  225. 225   // Block mousedown and click to prevent selection change
  226. 226   dom.bind(ed.getDoc(), 'mousedown', block);
  227. 227   dom.bind(ed.getDoc(), 'keydown', block);
  228. 228  
  229. 229   or = ed.selection.getRng();
  230. 230  
  231. 231   // Move caret into hidden div
  232. 232   n = n.firstChild;
  233. 233   rng = ed.getDoc().createRange();
  234. 234   rng.setStart(n, 0);
  235. 235   rng.setEnd(n, 1);
  236. 236   sel.setRng(rng);
  237. 237  
  238. 238   // Wait a while and grab the pasted contents
  239. 239   window.setTimeout(function() {
  240. 240   var h = '', nl;
  241. 241  
  242. 242   // Paste divs duplicated in paste divs seems to happen when you paste plain text so lets first look for that broken behavior in WebKit
  243. 243   if (!dom.select('div.mcePaste > div.mcePaste').length) {
  244. 244   nl = dom.select('div.mcePaste');
  245. 245  
  246. 246   // WebKit will split the div into multiple ones so this will loop through then all and join them to get the whole HTML string
  247. 247   each(nl, function(n) {
  248. 248   var child = n.firstChild;
  249. 249  
  250. 250   // WebKit inserts a DIV container with lots of odd styles
  251. 251   if (child && child.nodeName == 'DIV' && child.style.marginTop && child.style.backgroundColor) {
  252. 252   dom.remove(child, 1);
  253. 253   }
  254. 254  
  255. 255   // Remove apply style spans
  256. 256   each(dom.select('span.Apple-style-span', n), function(n) {
  257. 257   dom.remove(n, 1);
  258. 258   });
  259. 259  
  260. 260   // Remove bogus br elements
  261. 261   each(dom.select('br[data-mce-bogus]', n), function(n) {
  262. 262   dom.remove(n);
  263. 263   });
  264. 264  
  265. 265   // WebKit will make a copy of the DIV for each line of plain text pasted and insert them into the DIV
  266. 266   if (n.parentNode.className != 'mcePaste')
  267. 267   h += n.innerHTML;
  268. 268   });
  269. 269   } else {
  270. 270   // Found WebKit weirdness so force the content into plain text mode
  271. 271   h = '<pre>' + dom.encode(textContent).replace(/\r?\n/g, '<br />') + '</pre>';
  272. 272   }
  273. 273  
  274. 274   // Remove the nodes
  275. 275   each(dom.select('div.mcePaste'), function(n) {
  276. 276   dom.remove(n);
  277. 277   });
  278. 278  
  279. 279   // Restore the old selection
  280. 280   if (or)
  281. 281   sel.setRng(or);
  282. 282  
  283. 283   process({content : h});
  284. 284  
  285. 285   // Unblock events ones we got the contents
  286. 286   dom.unbind(ed.getDoc(), 'mousedown', block);
  287. 287   dom.unbind(ed.getDoc(), 'keydown', block);
  288. 288   }, 0);
  289. 289   }
  290. 290   }
  291. 291  
  292. 292   // Check if we should use the new auto process method
  293. 293   if (getParam(ed, "paste_auto_cleanup_on_paste")) {
  294. 294   // Is it's Opera or older FF use key handler
  295. 295   if (tinymce.isOpera || /Firefox\/2/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
  296. 296   ed.onKeyDown.addToTop(function(ed, e) {
  297. 297   if (((tinymce.isMac ? e.metaKey : e.ctrlKey) && e.keyCode == 86) || (e.shiftKey && e.keyCode == 45))
  298. 298   grabContent(e);
  299. 299   });
  300. 300   } else {
  301. 301   // Grab contents on paste event on Gecko and WebKit
  302. 302   ed.onPaste.addToTop(function(ed, e) {
  303. 303   return grabContent(e);
  304. 304   });
  305. 305   }
  306. 306   }
  307. 307  
  308. 308   // Block all drag/drop events
  309. 309   if (getParam(ed, "paste_block_drop")) {
  310. 310   ed.onInit.add(function() {
  311. 311   ed.dom.bind(ed.getBody(), ['dragend', 'dragover', 'draggesture', 'dragdrop', 'drop', 'drag'], function(e) {
  312. 312   e.preventDefault();
  313. 313   e.stopPropagation();
  314. 314  
  315. 315   return false;
  316. 316   });
  317. 317   });
  318. 318   }
  319. 319  
  320. 320   // Add legacy support
  321. 321   t._legacySupport();
  322. 322   },
  323. 323  
  324. 324   getInfo : function() {
  325. 325   return {
  326. 326   longname : 'Paste text/word',
  327. 327   author : 'Moxiecode Systems AB',
  328. 328   authorurl : 'http://tinymce.moxiecode.com',
  329. 329   infourl : 'http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Plugins/paste',
  330. 330   version : tinymce.majorVersion + "." + tinymce.minorVersion
  331. 331   };
  332. 332   },
  333. 333  
  334. 334   _preProcess : function(pl, o) {
  335. 335   var ed = this.editor,
  336. 336   h = o.content,
  337. 337   grep = tinymce.grep,
  338. 338   explode = tinymce.explode,
  339. 339   trim = tinymce.trim,
  340. 340   len, stripClass;
  341. 341  
  342. 342   //console.log('Before preprocess:' + o.content);
  343. 343  
  344. 344   function process(items) {
  345. 345   each(items, function(v) {
  346. 346   // Remove or replace
  347. 347   if (v.constructor == RegExp)
  348. 348   h = h.replace(v, '');
  349. 349   else
  350. 350   h = h.replace(v[0], v[1]);
  351. 351   });
  352. 352   }
  353. 353  
  354. 354   if (ed.settings.paste_enable_default_filters == false) {
  355. 355   return;
  356. 356   }
  357. 357  
  358. 358   // IE9 adds BRs before/after block elements when contents is pasted from word or for example another browser
  359. 359   if (tinymce.isIE && document.documentMode >= 9)
  360. 360   process([[/(?:<br>&nbsp;[\s\r\n]+|<br>)*(<\/?(h[1-6r]|p|div|address|pre|form|table|tbody|thead|tfoot|th|tr|td|li|ol|ul|caption|blockquote|center|dl|dt|dd|dir|fieldset)[^>]*>)(?:<br>&nbsp;[\s\r\n]+|<br>)*/g, '$1']]);
  361. 361  
  362. 362   // Detect Word content and process it more aggressive
  363. 363   if (/class="?Mso|style="[^"]*\bmso-|w:WordDocument/i.test(h) || o.wordContent) {
  364. 364   o.wordContent = true; // Mark the pasted contents as word specific content
  365. 365   //console.log('Word contents detected.');
  366. 366  
  367. 367   // Process away some basic content
  368. 368   process([
  369. 369   /^\s*(&nbsp;)+/gi, // &nbsp; entities at the start of contents
  370. 370   /(&nbsp;|<br[^>]*>)+\s*$/gi // &nbsp; entities at the end of contents
  371. 371   ]);
  372. 372  
  373. 373   if (getParam(ed, "paste_convert_headers_to_strong")) {
  374. 374   h = h.replace(/<p [^>]*class="?MsoHeading"?[^>]*>(.*?)<\/p>/gi, "<p><strong>$1</strong></p>");
  375. 375   }
  376. 376  
  377. 377   if (getParam(ed, "paste_convert_middot_lists")) {
  378. 378   process([
  379. 379   [/<!--\[if !supportLists\]-->/gi, '$&__MCE_ITEM__'], // Convert supportLists to a list item marker
  380. 380   [/(<span[^>]+(?:mso-list:|:\s*symbol)[^>]+>)/gi, '$1__MCE_ITEM__'], // Convert mso-list and symbol spans to item markers
  381. 381   [/(<p[^>]+(?:MsoListParagraph)[^>]+>)/gi, '$1__MCE_ITEM__'] // Convert mso-list and symbol paragraphs to item markers (FF)
  382. 382   ]);
  383. 383   }
  384. 384  
  385. 385   process([
  386. 386   // Word comments like conditional comments etc
  387. 387   /<!--[\s\S]+?-->/gi,
  388. 388  
  389. 389   // Remove comments, scripts (e.g., msoShowComment), XML tag, VML content, MS Office namespaced tags, and a few other tags
  390. 390   /<(!|script[^>]*>.*?<\/script(?=[>\s])|\/?(\?xml(:\w+)?|img|meta|link|style|\w:\w+)(?=[\s\/>]))[^>]*>/gi,
  391. 391  
  392. 392   // Convert <s> into <strike> for line-though
  393. 393   [/<(\/?)s>/gi, "<$1strike>"],
  394. 394  
  395. 395   // Replace nsbp entites to char since it's easier to handle
  396. 396   [/&nbsp;/gi, "\u00a0"]
  397. 397   ]);
  398. 398  
  399. 399   // Remove bad attributes, with or without quotes, ensuring that attribute text is really inside a tag.
  400. 400   // If JavaScript had a RegExp look-behind, we could have integrated this with the last process() array and got rid of the loop. But alas, it does not, so we cannot.
  401. 401   do {
  402. 402   len = h.length;
  403. 403   h = h.replace(/(<[a-z][^>]*\s)(?:id|name|language|type|on\w+|\w+:\w+)=(?:"[^"]*"|\w+)\s?/gi, "$1");
  404. 404   } while (len != h.length);
  405. 405  
  406. 406   // Remove all spans if no styles is to be retained
  407. 407   if (getParam(ed, "paste_retain_style_properties").replace(/^none$/i, "").length == 0) {
  408. 408   h = h.replace(/<\/?span[^>]*>/gi, "");
  409. 409   } else {
  410. 410   // We're keeping styles, so at least clean them up.
  411. 411   // CSS Reference: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa155477.aspx
  412. 412  
  413. 413   process([
  414. 414   // Convert <span style="mso-spacerun:yes">___</span> to string of alternating breaking/non-breaking spaces of same length
  415. 415   [/<span\s+style\s*=\s*"\s*mso-spacerun\s*:\s*yes\s*;?\s*"\s*>([\s\u00a0]*)<\/span>/gi,
  416. 416   function(str, spaces) {
  417. 417   return (spaces.length > 0)? spaces.replace(/./, " ").slice(Math.floor(spaces.length/2)).split("").join("\u00a0") : "";
  418. 418   }
  419. 419   ],
  420. 420  
  421. 421   // Examine all styles: delete junk, transform some, and keep the rest
  422. 422   [/(<[a-z][^>]*)\sstyle="([^"]*)"/gi,
  423. 423   function(str, tag, style) {
  424. 424   var n = [],
  425. 425   i = 0,
  426. 426   s = explode(trim(style).replace(/&quot;/gi, "'"), ";");
  427. 427  
  428. 428   // Examine each style definition within the tag's style attribute
  429. 429   each(s, function(v) {
  430. 430   var name, value,
  431. 431   parts = explode(v, ":");
  432. 432  
  433. 433   function ensureUnits(v) {
  434. 434   return v + ((v !== "0") && (/\d$/.test(v)))? "px" : "";
  435. 435   }
  436. 436  
  437. 437   if (parts.length == 2) {
  438. 438   name = parts[0].toLowerCase();
  439. 439   value = parts[1].toLowerCase();
  440. 440  
  441. 441   // Translate certain MS Office styles into their CSS equivalents
  442. 442   switch (name) {
  443. 443   case "mso-padding-alt":
  444. 444   case "mso-padding-top-alt":
  445. 445   case "mso-padding-right-alt":
  446. 446   case "mso-padding-bottom-alt":
  447. 447   case "mso-padding-left-alt":
  448. 448   case "mso-margin-alt":
  449. 449   case "mso-margin-top-alt":
  450. 450   case "mso-margin-right-alt":
  451. 451   case "mso-margin-bottom-alt":
  452. 452   case "mso-margin-left-alt":
  453. 453   case "mso-table-layout-alt":
  454. 454   case "mso-height":
  455. 455   case "mso-width":
  456. 456   case "mso-vertical-align-alt":
  457. 457   n[i++] = name.replace(/^mso-|-alt$/g, "") + ":" + ensureUnits(value);
  458. 458   return;
  459. 459  
  460. 460   case "horiz-align":
  461. 461   n[i++] = "text-align:" + value;
  462. 462   return;
  463. 463  
  464. 464   case "vert-align":
  465. 465   n[i++] = "vertical-align:" + value;
  466. 466   return;
  467. 467  
  468. 468   case "font-color":
  469. 469   case "mso-foreground":
  470. 470   n[i++] = "color:" + value;
  471. 471   return;
  472. 472  
  473. 473   case "mso-background":
  474. 474   case "mso-highlight":
  475. 475   n[i++] = "background:" + value;
  476. 476   return;
  477. 477  
  478. 478   case "mso-default-height":
  479. 479   n[i++] = "min-height:" + ensureUnits(value);
  480. 480   return;
  481. 481  
  482. 482   case "mso-default-width":
  483. 483   n[i++] = "min-width:" + ensureUnits(value);
  484. 484   return;
  485. 485  
  486. 486   case "mso-padding-between-alt":
  487. 487   n[i++] = "border-collapse:separate;border-spacing:" + ensureUnits(value);
  488. 488   return;
  489. 489  
  490. 490   case "text-line-through":
  491. 491   if ((value == "single") || (value == "double")) {
  492. 492   n[i++] = "text-decoration:line-through";
  493. 493   }
  494. 494   return;
  495. 495  
  496. 496   case "mso-zero-height":
  497. 497   if (value == "yes") {
  498. 498   n[i++] = "display:none";
  499. 499   }
  500. 500   return;
  501. 501   }
  502. 502  
  503. 503   // Eliminate all MS Office style definitions that have no CSS equivalent by examining the first characters in the name
  504. 504   if (/^(mso|column|font-emph|lang|layout|line-break|list-image|nav|panose|punct|row|ruby|sep|size|src|tab-|table-border|text-(?!align|decor|indent|trans)|top-bar|version|vnd|word-break)/.test(name)) {
  505. 505   return;
  506. 506   }
  507. 507  
  508. 508   // If it reached this point, it must be a valid CSS style
  509. 509   n[i++] = name + ":" + parts[1]; // Lower-case name, but keep value case
  510. 510   }
  511. 511   });
  512. 512  
  513. 513   // If style attribute contained any valid styles the re-write it; otherwise delete style attribute.
  514. 514   if (i > 0) {
  515. 515   return tag + ' style="' + n.join(';') + '"';
  516. 516   } else {
  517. 517   return tag;
  518. 518   }
  519. 519   }
  520. 520   ]
  521. 521   ]);
  522. 522   }
  523. 523   }
  524. 524  
  525. 525   // Replace headers with <strong>
  526. 526   if (getParam(ed, "paste_convert_headers_to_strong")) {
  527. 527   process([
  528. 528   [/<h[1-6][^>]*>/gi, "<p><strong>"],
  529. 529   [/<\/h[1-6][^>]*>/gi, "</strong></p>"]
  530. 530   ]);
  531. 531   }
  532. 532  
  533. 533   process([
  534. 534   // Copy paste from Java like Open Office will produce this junk on FF
  535. 535   [/Version:[\d.]+\nStartHTML:\d+\nEndHTML:\d+\nStartFragment:\d+\nEndFragment:\d+/gi, '']
  536. 536   ]);
  537. 537  
  538. 538   // Class attribute options are: leave all as-is ("none"), remove all ("all"), or remove only those starting with mso ("mso").
  539. 539   // Note:- paste_strip_class_attributes: "none", verify_css_classes: true is also a good variation.
  540. 540   stripClass = getParam(ed, "paste_strip_class_attributes");
  541. 541  
  542. 542   if (stripClass !== "none") {
  543. 543   function removeClasses(match, g1) {
  544. 544   if (stripClass === "all")
  545. 545   return '';
  546. 546  
  547. 547   var cls = grep(explode(g1.replace(/^(["'])(.*)\1$/, "$2"), " "),
  548. 548   function(v) {
  549. 549   return (/^(?!mso)/i.test(v));
  550. 550   }
  551. 551   );
  552. 552  
  553. 553   return cls.length ? ' class="' + cls.join(" ") + '"' : '';
  554. 554   };
  555. 555  
  556. 556   h = h.replace(/ class="([^"]+)"/gi, removeClasses);
  557. 557   h = h.replace(/ class=([\-\w]+)/gi, removeClasses);
  558. 558   }
  559. 559  
  560. 560   // Remove spans option
  561. 561   if (getParam(ed, "paste_remove_spans")) {
  562. 562   h = h.replace(/<\/?span[^>]*>/gi, "");
  563. 563   }
  564. 564  
  565. 565   //console.log('After preprocess:' + h);
  566. 566  
  567. 567   o.content = h;
  568. 568   },
  569. 569  
  570. 570   /**
  571. 571   * Various post process items.
  572. 572   */
  573. 573   _postProcess : function(pl, o) {
  574. 574   var t = this, ed = t.editor, dom = ed.dom, styleProps;
  575. 575  
  576. 576   if (ed.settings.paste_enable_default_filters == false) {
  577. 577   return;
  578. 578   }
  579. 579  
  580. 580   if (o.wordContent) {
  581. 581   // Remove named anchors or TOC links
  582. 582   each(dom.select('a', o.node), function(a) {
  583. 583   if (!a.href || a.href.indexOf('#_Toc') != -1)
  584. 584   dom.remove(a, 1);
  585. 585   });
  586. 586  
  587. 587   if (getParam(ed, "paste_convert_middot_lists")) {
  588. 588   t._convertLists(pl, o);
  589. 589   }
  590. 590  
  591. 591   // Process styles
  592. 592   styleProps = getParam(ed, "paste_retain_style_properties"); // retained properties
  593. 593  
  594. 594   // Process only if a string was specified and not equal to "all" or "*"
  595. 595   if ((tinymce.is(styleProps, "string")) && (styleProps !== "all") && (styleProps !== "*")) {
  596. 596   styleProps = tinymce.explode(styleProps.replace(/^none$/i, ""));
  597. 597  
  598. 598   // Retains some style properties
  599. 599   each(dom.select('*', o.node), function(el) {
  600. 600   var newStyle = {}, npc = 0, i, sp, sv;
  601. 601  
  602. 602   // Store a subset of the existing styles
  603. 603   if (styleProps) {
  604. 604   for (i = 0; i < styleProps.length; i++) {
  605. 605   sp = styleProps[i];
  606. 606   sv = dom.getStyle(el, sp);
  607. 607  
  608. 608   if (sv) {
  609. 609   newStyle[sp] = sv;
  610. 610   npc++;
  611. 611   }
  612. 612   }
  613. 613   }
  614. 614  
  615. 615   // Remove all of the existing styles
  616. 616   dom.setAttrib(el, 'style', '');
  617. 617  
  618. 618   if (styleProps && npc > 0)
  619. 619   dom.setStyles(el, newStyle); // Add back the stored subset of styles
  620. 620   else // Remove empty span tags that do not have class attributes
  621. 621   if (el.nodeName == 'SPAN' && !el.className)
  622. 622   dom.remove(el, true);
  623. 623   });
  624. 624   }
  625. 625   }
  626. 626  
  627. 627   // Remove all style information or only specifically on WebKit to avoid the style bug on that browser
  628. 628   if (getParam(ed, "paste_remove_styles") || (getParam(ed, "paste_remove_styles_if_webkit") && tinymce.isWebKit)) {
  629. 629   each(dom.select('*[style]', o.node), function(el) {
  630. 630   el.removeAttribute('style');
  631. 631   el.removeAttribute('data-mce-style');
  632. 632   });
  633. 633   } else {
  634. 634   if (tinymce.isWebKit) {
  635. 635   // We need to compress the styles on WebKit since if you paste <img border="0" /> it will become <img border="0" style="... lots of junk ..." />
  636. 636   // Removing the mce_style that contains the real value will force the Serializer engine to compress the styles
  637. 637   each(dom.select('*', o.node), function(el) {
  638. 638   el.removeAttribute('data-mce-style');
  639. 639   });
  640. 640   }
  641. 641   }
  642. 642   },
  643. 643  
  644. 644   /**
  645. 645   * Converts the most common bullet and number formats in Office into a real semantic UL/LI list.
  646. 646   */
  647. 647   _convertLists : function(pl, o) {
  648. 648   var dom = pl.editor.dom, listElm, li, lastMargin = -1, margin, levels = [], lastType, html;
  649. 649  
  650. 650   // Convert middot lists into real semantic lists
  651. 651   each(dom.select('p', o.node), function(p) {
  652. 652   var sib, val = '', type, html, idx, parents;
  653. 653  
  654. 654   // Get text node value at beginning of paragraph
  655. 655   for (sib = p.firstChild; sib && sib.nodeType == 3; sib = sib.nextSibling)
  656. 656   val += sib.nodeValue;
  657. 657  
  658. 658   val = p.innerHTML.replace(/<\/?\w+[^>]*>/gi, '').replace(/&nbsp;/g, '\u00a0');
  659. 659  
  660. 660   // Detect unordered lists look for bullets
  661. 661   if (/^(__MCE_ITEM__)+[\u2022\u00b7\u00a7\u00d8o\u25CF]\s*\u00a0*/.test(val))
  662. 662   type = 'ul';
  663. 663  
  664. 664   // Detect ordered lists 1., a. or ixv.
  665. 665   if (/^__MCE_ITEM__\s*\w+\.\s*\u00a0+/.test(val))
  666. 666   type = 'ol';
  667. 667  
  668. 668   // Check if node value matches the list pattern: o&nbsp;&nbsp;
  669. 669   if (type) {
  670. 670   margin = parseFloat(p.style.marginLeft || 0);
  671. 671  
  672. 672   if (margin > lastMargin)
  673. 673   levels.push(margin);
  674. 674  
  675. 675   if (!listElm || type != lastType) {
  676. 676   listElm = dom.create(type);
  677. 677   dom.insertAfter(listElm, p);
  678. 678   } else {
  679. 679   // Nested list element
  680. 680   if (margin > lastMargin) {
  681. 681   listElm = li.appendChild(dom.create(type));
  682. 682   } else if (margin < lastMargin) {
  683. 683   // Find parent level based on margin value
  684. 684   idx = tinymce.inArray(levels, margin);
  685. 685   parents = dom.getParents(listElm.parentNode, type);
  686. 686   listElm = parents[parents.length - 1 - idx] || listElm;
  687. 687   }
  688. 688   }
  689. 689  
  690. 690   // Remove middot or number spans if they exists
  691. 691   each(dom.select('span', p), function(span) {
  692. 692   var html = span.innerHTML.replace(/<\/?\w+[^>]*>/gi, '');
  693. 693  
  694. 694   // Remove span with the middot or the number
  695. 695   if (type == 'ul' && /^__MCE_ITEM__[\u2022\u00b7\u00a7\u00d8o\u25CF]/.test(html))
  696. 696   dom.remove(span);
  697. 697   else if (/^__MCE_ITEM__[\s\S]*\w+\.(&nbsp;|\u00a0)*\s*/.test(html))
  698. 698   dom.remove(span);
  699. 699   });
  700. 700  
  701. 701   html = p.innerHTML;
  702. 702  
  703. 703   // Remove middot/list items
  704. 704   if (type == 'ul')
  705. 705   html = p.innerHTML.replace(/__MCE_ITEM__/g, '').replace(/^[\u2022\u00b7\u00a7\u00d8o\u25CF]\s*(&nbsp;|\u00a0)+\s*/, '');
  706. 706   else
  707. 707   html = p.innerHTML.replace(/__MCE_ITEM__/g, '').replace(/^\s*\w+\.(&nbsp;|\u00a0)+\s*/, '');
  708. 708  
  709. 709   // Create li and add paragraph data into the new li
  710. 710   li = listElm.appendChild(dom.create('li', 0, html));
  711. 711   dom.remove(p);
  712. 712  
  713. 713   lastMargin = margin;
  714. 714   lastType = type;
  715. 715   } else
  716. 716   listElm = lastMargin = 0; // End list element
  717. 717   });
  718. 718  
  719. 719   // Remove any left over makers
  720. 720   html = o.node.innerHTML;
  721. 721   if (html.indexOf('__MCE_ITEM__') != -1)
  722. 722   o.node.innerHTML = html.replace(/__MCE_ITEM__/g, '');
  723. 723   },
  724. 724  
  725. 725   /**
  726. 726   * Inserts the specified contents at the caret position.
  727. 727   */
  728. 728   _insert : function(h, skip_undo) {
  729. 729   var ed = this.editor, r = ed.selection.getRng();
  730. 730  
  731. 731   // First delete the contents seems to work better on WebKit when the selection spans multiple list items or multiple table cells.
  732. 732   if (!ed.selection.isCollapsed() && r.startContainer != r.endContainer)
  733. 733   ed.getDoc().execCommand('Delete', false, null);
  734. 734  
  735. 735   ed.execCommand('mceInsertContent', false, h, {skip_undo : skip_undo});
  736. 736   },
  737. 737  
  738. 738   /**
  739. 739   * Instead of the old plain text method which tried to re-create a paste operation, the
  740. 740   * new approach adds a plain text mode toggle switch that changes the behavior of paste.
  741. 741   * This function is passed the same input that the regular paste plugin produces.
  742. 742   * It performs additional scrubbing and produces (and inserts) the plain text.
  743. 743   * This approach leverages all of the great existing functionality in the paste
  744. 744   * plugin, and requires minimal changes to add the new functionality.
  745. 745   * Speednet - June 2009
  746. 746   */
  747. 747   _insertPlainText : function(ed, dom, h) {
  748. 748   var i, len, pos, rpos, node, breakElms, before, after,
  749. 749   w = ed.getWin(),
  750. 750   d = ed.getDoc(),
  751. 751   sel = ed.selection,
  752. 752   is = tinymce.is,
  753. 753   inArray = tinymce.inArray,
  754. 754   linebr = getParam(ed, "paste_text_linebreaktype"),
  755. 755   rl = getParam(ed, "paste_text_replacements");
  756. 756  
  757. 757   function process(items) {
  758. 758   each(items, function(v) {
  759. 759   if (v.constructor == RegExp)
  760. 760   h = h.replace(v, "");
  761. 761   else
  762. 762   h = h.replace(v[0], v[1]);
  763. 763   });
  764. 764   };
  765. 765  
  766. 766   if ((typeof(h) === "string") && (h.length > 0)) {
  767. 767   // If HTML content with line-breaking tags, then remove all cr/lf chars because only tags will break a line
  768. 768   if (/<(?:p|br|h[1-6]|ul|ol|dl|table|t[rdh]|div|blockquote|fieldset|pre|address|center)[^>]*>/i.test(h)) {
  769. 769   process([
  770. 770   /[\n\r]+/g
  771. 771   ]);
  772. 772   } else {
  773. 773   // Otherwise just get rid of carriage returns (only need linefeeds)
  774. 774   process([
  775. 775   /\r+/g
  776. 776   ]);
  777. 777   }
  778. 778  
  779. 779   process([
  780. 780   [/<\/(?:p|h[1-6]|ul|ol|dl|table|div|blockquote|fieldset|pre|address|center)>/gi, "\n\n"], // Block tags get a blank line after them
  781. 781   [/<br[^>]*>|<\/tr>/gi, "\n"], // Single linebreak for <br /> tags and table rows
  782. 782   [/<\/t[dh]>\s*<t[dh][^>]*>/gi, "\t"], // Table cells get tabs betweem them
  783. 783   /<[a-z!\/?][^>]*>/gi, // Delete all remaining tags
  784. 784   [/&nbsp;/gi, " "], // Convert non-break spaces to regular spaces (remember, *plain text*)
  785. 785   [/(?:(?!\n)\s)*(\n+)(?:(?!\n)\s)*/gi, "$1"], // Cool little RegExp deletes whitespace around linebreak chars.
  786. 786   [/\n{3,}/g, "\n\n"], // Max. 2 consecutive linebreaks
  787. 787   /^\s+|\s+$/g // Trim the front & back
  788. 788   ]);
  789. 789  
  790. 790   h = dom.decode(tinymce.html.Entities.encodeRaw(h));
  791. 791  
  792. 792   // Delete any highlighted text before pasting
  793. 793   if (!sel.isCollapsed()) {
  794. 794   d.execCommand("Delete", false, null);
  795. 795   }
  796. 796  
  797. 797   // Perform default or custom replacements
  798. 798   if (is(rl, "array") || (is(rl, "array"))) {
  799. 799   process(rl);
  800. 800   }
  801. 801   else if (is(rl, "string")) {
  802. 802   process(new RegExp(rl, "gi"));
  803. 803   }
  804. 804  
  805. 805   // Treat paragraphs as specified in the config
  806. 806   if (linebr == "none") {
  807. 807   process([
  808. 808   [/\n+/g, " "]
  809. 809   ]);
  810. 810   }
  811. 811   else if (linebr == "br") {
  812. 812   process([
  813. 813   [/\n/g, "<br />"]
  814. 814   ]);
  815. 815   }
  816. 816   else {
  817. 817   process([
  818. 818   /^\s+|\s+$/g,
  819. 819   [/\n\n/g, "</p><p>"],
  820. 820   [/\n/g, "<br />"]
  821. 821   ]);
  822. 822   }
  823. 823  
  824. 824   // This next piece of code handles the situation where we're pasting more than one paragraph of plain
  825. 825   // text, and we are pasting the content into the middle of a block node in the editor. The block
  826. 826   // node gets split at the selection point into "Para A" and "Para B" (for the purposes of explaining).
  827. 827   // The first paragraph of the pasted text is appended to "Para A", and the last paragraph of the
  828. 828   // pasted text is prepended to "Para B". Any other paragraphs of pasted text are placed between
  829. 829   // "Para A" and "Para B". This code solves a host of problems with the original plain text plugin and
  830. 830   // now handles styles correctly. (Pasting plain text into a styled paragraph is supposed to make the
  831. 831   // plain text take the same style as the existing paragraph.)
  832. 832   if ((pos = h.indexOf("</p><p>")) != -1) {
  833. 833   rpos = h.lastIndexOf("</p><p>");
  834. 834   node = sel.getNode();
  835. 835   breakElms = []; // Get list of elements to break
  836. 836  
  837. 837   do {
  838. 838   if (node.nodeType == 1) {
  839. 839   // Don't break tables and break at body
  840. 840   if (node.nodeName == "TD" || node.nodeName == "BODY") {
  841. 841   break;
  842. 842   }
  843. 843  
  844. 844   breakElms[breakElms.length] = node;
  845. 845   }
  846. 846   } while (node = node.parentNode);
  847. 847  
  848. 848   // Are we in the middle of a block node?
  849. 849   if (breakElms.length > 0) {
  850. 850   before = h.substring(0, pos);
  851. 851   after = "";
  852. 852  
  853. 853   for (i=0, len=breakElms.length; i<len; i++) {
  854. 854   before += "</" + breakElms[i].nodeName.toLowerCase() + ">";
  855. 855   after += "<" + breakElms[breakElms.length-i-1].nodeName.toLowerCase() + ">";
  856. 856   }
  857. 857  
  858. 858   if (pos == rpos) {
  859. 859   h = before + after + h.substring(pos+7);
  860. 860   }
  861. 861   else {
  862. 862   h = before + h.substring(pos+4, rpos+4) + after + h.substring(rpos+7);
  863. 863   }
  864. 864   }
  865. 865   }
  866. 866  
  867. 867   // Insert content at the caret, plus add a marker for repositioning the caret
  868. 868   ed.execCommand("mceInsertRawHTML", false, h + '<span id="_plain_text_marker">&nbsp;</span>');
  869. 869  
  870. 870   // Reposition the caret to the marker, which was placed immediately after the inserted content.
  871. 871   // Needs to be done asynchronously (in window.setTimeout) or else it doesn't work in all browsers.
  872. 872   // The second part of the code scrolls the content up if the caret is positioned off-screen.
  873. 873   // This is only necessary for WebKit browsers, but it doesn't hurt to use for all.
  874. 874   window.setTimeout(function() {
  875. 875   var marker = dom.get('_plain_text_marker'),
  876. 876   elm, vp, y, elmHeight;
  877. 877  
  878. 878   sel.select(marker, false);
  879. 879   d.execCommand("Delete", false, null);
  880. 880   marker = null;
  881. 881  
  882. 882   // Get element, position and height
  883. 883   elm = sel.getStart();
  884. 884   vp = dom.getViewPort(w);
  885. 885   y = dom.getPos(elm).y;
  886. 886   elmHeight = elm.clientHeight;
  887. 887  
  888. 888   // Is element within viewport if not then scroll it into view
  889. 889   if ((y < vp.y) || (y + elmHeight > vp.y + vp.h)) {
  890. 890   d.body.scrollTop = y < vp.y ? y : y - vp.h + 25;
  891. 891   }
  892. 892   }, 0);
  893. 893   }
  894. 894   },
  895. 895  
  896. 896   /**
  897. 897   * This method will open the old style paste dialogs. Some users might want the old behavior but still use the new cleanup engine.
  898. 898   */
  899. 899   _legacySupport : function() {
  900. 900   var t = this, ed = t.editor;
  901. 901  
  902. 902   // Register command(s) for backwards compatibility
  903. 903   ed.addCommand("mcePasteWord", function() {
  904. 904   ed.windowManager.open({
  905. 905   file: t.url + "/pasteword.htm",
  906. 906   width: parseInt(getParam(ed, "paste_dialog_width")),
  907. 907   height: parseInt(getParam(ed, "paste_dialog_height")),
  908. 908   inline: 1
  909. 909   });
  910. 910   });
  911. 911  
  912. 912   if (getParam(ed, "paste_text_use_dialog")) {
  913. 913   ed.addCommand("mcePasteText", function() {
  914. 914   ed.windowManager.open({
  915. 915   file : t.url + "/pastetext.htm",
  916. 916   width: parseInt(getParam(ed, "paste_dialog_width")),
  917. 917   height: parseInt(getParam(ed, "paste_dialog_height")),
  918. 918   inline : 1
  919. 919   });
  920. 920   });
  921. 921   }
  922. 922  
  923. 923   // Register button for backwards compatibility
  924. 924   ed.addButton("pasteword", {title : "paste.paste_word_desc", cmd : "mcePasteWord"});
  925. 925   }
  926. 926   });
  927. 927  
  928. 928   // Register plugin
  929. 929   tinymce.PluginManager.add("paste", tinymce.plugins.PastePlugin);
  930. 930  })();
